column4: Hrm, is there a good reason for a new Ubuntu installation with barely anything added to use 5.0 GB already? What are  some huge things installed by defualt that can be removed?
LiVES absolutely must be compiled? No DEBs exist?
LiVES, when attempting to ./configure, says it needs "gtk+2.0". I have gtk 2.0. What the hell?
I Deleted my apt cache and now I get, "E: Archive directory /var/cache/apt/archives/partial is missing". How do I fix this? :P
did you manually clean the cache?
I just erased the dir contents of /cache/apt/archives
apt-get clean/autoclean would have been the right way...
is this woeful fuckery of mine fixable?
I think that it's not so dangerous, but I don't know what to do
